"Chuck Hinson" <chuck.hinson@...> writes:

> What I've read earlier in this thread leads me to believe that some people
> believe that the second construction in the example would not be RESTful.
> By my (likely inappropriate) algebra, it seems to me that the second
> construction would be RESTful, but I really don't know and was hoping
> someone could explain.

It's not black and white like that.

One could say that such an app was "not very RESTfull" because it had
low cacheability for no particular gain (internal, single machine
performance?)

But one resource doesn't really REST make. So to talk about the
relative RESTfull-ness of it seems pretty odd to me anyway.

Plus, it's not black and white like that  /8->
